description:
WHY JOIN ALO?

Mindful movement. It’s at the core of why we do what we do at Alo—it’s our calling. Because mindful movement in the studio leads to better living. It changes who yogis are off the mat, making their lives and their communities better. That’s the real meaning of studio-to-street: taking the consciousness from practice on the mat and putting it into practice in life.

OVERVIEW

Lead initiatives to continuously improve processes, from sourcing raw materials to final product delivery. Implement best practices, harness data-driven insights, and foster a culture of continuous improvement to optimize efficiency and quality.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Strategic Oversight of DC Operations:

Provide strategic direction and oversight to ensure seamless operations at our distribution centers. Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to streamline processes, reduce bottlenecks, and ensure timely delivery of high-quality products to our customers.

  • Championing Cutting Operations Excellence:

Direct and supervise cutting operations, material management from fabric sourcing, dyeing, and cutting processes. Ensure adherence to strict quality standards and regulatory requirements while driving innovation and efficiency in our cutting operations.

  • Proactive Management of Audit Processes:

Take a proactive approach to identify and mitigate delays in the audit process related to product integrity. Work collaboratively with internal audit teams to establish robust audit procedures, address any compliance issues promptly, and maintain audit readiness at all times.

  • Ownership of Aging Report Strategies:

Take ownership of aging reports to proactively identify and address potential product integrity issues. Develop and implement strategies to minimize the impact of aging inventory, drive inventory optimization efforts, and ensure the timely resolution of any product integrity concerns.

  • Streamlining PI Issue Resolution:

Develop and implement a robust process for resolving issues swiftly and effectively. Conduct thorough root cause analyses, implement corrective and preventive actions, and collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to address issues and drive sustainable solutions.

Requirements

  • Bachelor's degree in Textiles; Master's degree preferred.
  • 10+ years of progressive experience in product operations or related field.
  • Demonstrated leadership skills, People & Process oriented with the ability to inspire and lead cross-functional teams.
  • Strong analytical mindset and problem-solving ability.
  • Deep understanding of quality assurance principles and methodologies.
  • Proficiency in process improvement methodologies such as Six Sigma or Lean.
  • Master black belt preferred.
  • Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.

The base salary range for this position is $140,000 - $160,000 per year which represents the current range for the base salary for this exempt position. Please note that actual salaries will vary based on factors including but not limited to location, experience, and performance. As such, on occasion and when applicable, there is the possibility that the final, agreed-upon base salary may be outside of the upper end of the range. Please also note the range listed is just one component of the company’s total rewards package for exempt employees. Other rewards may include performance bonuses, long term incentives, a PTO policy, and many other progressive benefits.
